metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8890 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The inet_csk_clone_lock function in net/ipv4/inet_connection_sock.c in the Linux kernel through 4.10.15 allows attackers to cause a denial of service (double free) or possibly have unspecified other impact by leveraging use of the accept system call. It was discovered that a double-free vulnerability existed in the IPv4 stack of the Linux kernel. An attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8890` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-123-generic - 3.13.0-123.172
linux-image-3.13.0-123-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-123.172
linux-image-3.13.0-123-lowlatency - 3.13.0-123.172
linux-image-3.13.0-123-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-123.172
linux-image-3.13.0-123-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-123.172
linux-image-3.13.0-123-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-123.172
linux-image-3.13.0-123-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-123.172
linux-image-3.13.0-123-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-123.172
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-123-generic - 3.13.0-123.172
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-123.172').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-83.106~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-manta: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-signed package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-123.172').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-83.106~14.04.1').
